			[1023] paragraph ''
				StaticText "Chrome extension that replaces occurrences of 'the cloud' with 'my butt'"
			[1024] paragraph ''
				[1025] link 'Direct download of crx file', url='https://github.com/panicsteve/cloud-to-butt/blob/master/CloudToButt.crx?raw=true'
			[1026] paragraph ''
				StaticText "Note that there are forks of this extension that simply replace 'cloud' with 'butt'. In my personal opinion, that approach is too broad and it's less funny as a result, but it is clearly a very polarizing issue in the cloud-to-butt user community. Forks are free to do whatever they like. But officially,"
				[1027] emphasis ''
					StaticText 'this'
				StaticText 'extension replaces only the phrase described above, and therefore it did not replace your cloudflare URLs with buttflare URLs. Thank you for your concern.'

step_data.thought: I'm currently on the project page for 'cloud-to-butt'. I can see that this project already has two topics: 'chrome-extension' and 'text-replacement'. To add a new topic, I need to find where I can edit the project settings or specifically the topics section. Looking at the sidebar, I see there's a 'Settings' link which would likely contain options to modify project details including topics. Let me click on the Settings link.
